_header: This land was first by Gods ordinaunce
Subjects: political poems; Edward IV, right of succession; England, kings of; Yorkist lords
_description: ‘Titulus Regis Edwardi Quarti’, the Yorkist genealogical chronicle — 27 stanzas rhyme royal

Aylesford.First Lines:
Thys londe was furste Be goddys ordynaunceInhabyt wythe Brytons
                    full longe Agone…
Aylesford.Last Lines:
…Thus god to the ryȝt has gravnted the degreAt þe
                    last Trowthe abydus when falseud dose fle
Aylesford.Note: Photocopies in Warwickshire Record Office, Z 155[L], and CoventryAcc351.
Aylesford.Attributed Title:
Titulus Regis Edwardi Quarti ad Coronam Anglie Sanguine Bruti et
                        Cadwaldi Quondam Regis Britonum (top of roll)
Aylesford.Editions:
Louis,  Cameron. 
             “A Yorkist Genealogical Chronicle in Middle English Verse.” 
             Anglia
         109 (1991): 1-20: 10-20.
